intro: Hieracium praecurrens subsp. hunedoarae, commonly known as the Hunedoara hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces yellowish to orange composite flowers, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. This subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and morphological traits.
